content: The Accordion component displays a list of items that can be expanded or collapsed. It is built using the `Accordion` and `AccordionItem` components. Key features include adding subtitles, expanding multiple items (`selectionMode="multiple"`), and a compact style (`isCompact`).
The Accordion has four style variants: `light` (default), `shadow`, `bordered`, and `splitted`.

Accordions can have default expanded items (`defaultExpandedKeys`), disabled items (`disabledKeys`), and custom start content (`startContent`). The open/close indicator can also be customized or hidden.
Accordion is a controlled component. To manage its state, you need to control the `selectedKeys` prop and handle the `onSelectionChange` event.
The AccordionItem has many stylable parts (slots), including: `base`, `heading`, `trigger`, `title`, `subtitle`, `indicator`, and `content`.
Accordion supports full keyboard navigation (Arrow keys, Home/End) and uses appropriate ARIA attributes like `aria-expanded` and `aria-disabled` for screen readers.
Key props for the Accordion component include `variant`, `selectionMode`, `isCompact`, `disabledKeys`, and `itemClasses`. For AccordionItem, key props are `title`, `subtitle`, and `indicator`.
